column4: I just installed Ubuntu 8.10 from the Mini.iso file (network install) and everything seemed to install fine; however, now that I've reached the login page, my monitor only displays that I need to set my screen res. to 1680 x 1050 @60Hz or lower. What do I do to lower my res. w/out a GUI?
join the group. Im having the same issues and noone knows anything.
I tried to ask yesterday and noone helped.
Hm.
something is wrong with xserver.
have you tried to reconfigure it?
I don't know how, I'm fairly new with this.
ok hang on. let me get you the command.
./sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
type that in terminal.
- the ./
I need to get to a terminal, though.
you dont have gui?
Nope.
well you can still do that from the command line.
yeah.
^ that
Yep, ok, gonna try typing that in.
ok
anyone know why my xorg.conf isnt recognizing any of my hardware? I tried to reconfigure X a few times.. nothing seems to work
Mit: that working?
Well, it functions, but it doesn't fix my problem.
